data.title: Decent Indian food
data.text:
The atmosphere is okay.  Could use some more popular Indian videos and music.  There was plenty food for the price.  I like the more authentic spicy Indian food and so this was low on the spice side. 

They are close by and so its good when I don't have much time.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: The food is delicious, service is pretty good, and the price is a STEAL. Lunch(everyday 11-2) is only $9.99 and dinner on the weekends is $14.99. Best Indian spot in Hayward!

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: My husband and I like to try new places when we go out.  Now that is going to be very hard to do because I am always going to want to go the Favorite Indian Restaurant!  From the moment we walked in we were warmly welcomed, seated right away and shown the buffet.  Normally I do not like buffets but this was the perfect way to try so many of the fantastic foods available.  Everything was clean, all the food was fresh and tasty.  Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Good Food - Good Prices
data.text: Friends took me here for the first time several years ago - and now, if I want to go to a sit-down Indian restaurant I go here. The prices are reasonable! The food is good!

data.title: Excellent Indian Food
data.text: Our "favorite" Indian food restaurant.  The food is always delicious.  We always select naan and butter chicken then go from there.

data.title: Variety of food
data.text:
My friend recommended this place for our get together and so it is worth it for the food you get for the lunch buffet which costs about $10.95 after the Yelp check-in.  You don't pay until after the buffet so I showed them my yelp check-in and the three of us got the discount, so nice! 

This is my first time here as I hardly ever eat Indian food as I don't eat too much spice but the food was just right.  Lately, my friends have been wanting to eat different kinds of spicy food!  So I'm game to try new things.  The curries to me were medium spicy and the naan was delish!  For dessert, there's a machine for mango ice cream to cool off your tongue!

data.title: Consistently Tasty Food at Favorite Indian Restaurant
data.text: Favorite Indian Restaurant in Hayward continues to be one of my go-to places because of their consistently good food, reasonable prices, and -especially- because of their complimentary local delivery service, a real plus on those evenings in which I don't want to go out. This time I tried their mixed-lentil vegetarian dish- it was very good. Other favorites of mine include their aloo gobi, mushroom mataar, vegetable samosa, tandoori chicken, and various naan breads. They always include a huge amount of white rice- way more than I can ever eat.

data.title: Lunch is always very good
data.text: This place has always provided me my Indian food fix.  The service, quality and variety of food offered have kept me coming through the years.  I'm a fan👍🏼

data.title: A must try for the Indian Food lover
data.text: This is my "favorite" Indian spot outside of Fremont. A must try on any Friday or Saturday night. The lunch buffet is equally solid. The ambiance is fitting, as Bollywood videos play on the monitors in the dining area... The owners have done a nice job. I would caution eating here in late afternoon or early evening hours because they close daily between lunch and dinner.

data.title: A Favorite in Hayward
data.text: We have been going to Favorite Indian for over 15 years, 4-5 times per year.  The buffets are excellent, well spiced and never too crowded.  Good selection of non-meat and meat dishes.  Nans (garlic or not) are offered. The meals go well washed down with Indian beer.  One can make a tasty dessert concoction with the gulab jamun, rice pudding and mango ice cream.  One of the waiters was very friendly always joking.  And one gets Frequent Flyer points.

data.title: Food is good but not exellent
data.text: Visited this restaurant on 25th May 2016 for dinner, location is good but food here is OK but not very good. We tried the buffet dinner there was a good variety in the vegetarian section but only one dish in the non-veg section. Nan quality was very thick, but sweet dish was very good..

data.title: Top notch tasty Indian Food
data.text: Great delivery service! Very tasty and always appropriately spiced. All the usual favorites with a specialty in Dosa. Great for vegetarians! Great prices!

data.title: Really Nice Buffet - Even for Dinner
data.text:
I'm pretty sure that this used to be a fast food place of some kind, or maybe a Friendly's.  So, don't expect too much in the way of atmosphere - it's pretty "utilitarian".

That being said, they have an extensive buffet - which is actually really nice since diners may sample a wide variety of dishes.

The service was very friendly and attentive, and the prices were quite reasonable.

I like Indian cuisine, and I enjoyed the food here as well.  The blend of flavor and "heat" was just right.  Spicy dishes had a pleasant, but not overpowering kick to them, and the mild dishes had the right complexity to make them enjoyable.

If you like Indian cuisine (or if you would like to try it to find out) and you are in the area, this is a very good choice.

data.title: Hotel
data.text:
Excellent buffet. Variety of food from different parts of India and excellent service. 
The menu in the buffet is always changing. I love that idea not having to eat the same item over and over again.
Consistency in flavor need to improve but overall, I give A-

data.title: Wide Variety of Quality Indian Cuisine
data.text: I'm a huge fan of the unique flavors of Indian cuisine. But I often find USA Indian restaurants tone down the spices and what's left is boring. Not so at Favorite Indian. Very good and unique flavors across a variety of different dishes so it doesn't all taste the same! Menu items such as goat curry and lamb meatballs add a nice unique variation to the conventional Chicken Masala and Tandoori Chicken. And I appreciate that items on the buffet aren't sitting there for hours and getting way overcooked. They regularly refresh the warming trays and rarely do you get rubber chicken, meat or fish like so many other buffet restaurants (you can order off the menu as well). I also should point out that the service is very friendly and they are very accommodating to your requests and the price is fair.

data.title: Wonderful food!
data.text: We have Favorite Indian food often! They deliver - and fast! Our favorites are Chicken Masala and Tandoori Chicken. The chutney is to die for - both green and red! Be sure to order extra, you will want to put it on everything.

data.title: A frequent destination
data.text: I started going here for lunch buffet back when they only had the A Street location.  It quickly became one of my favorite places to eat.  I have recommended an innumerable amount of people there and everyone loves it.  The lunch buffet is a great value and the dinner buffet is even better.  I go at least 3 times a month.  It is addicting.  There is not one thing that is not to like.  Is it the most authentic Indian food around?  Probably not.  But is it the most delicious with the fastest service and a friendly staff? Yes, yes, and yes.  This restaurant truly lives up  to its name as "My Favorite Indian" Restaurant

data.title: Good curry
data.text:
Finally convinced my wife to eat indian foods!!!
A lady welcome you and let   us choose our spot where to sit.
After ordering drinks and apetizers in a big plate with different tastes of India.
You can savor those distinctives flavors and ask for more spicynees if you desire. (i did)
The curries camr and then our nostrils were like brought to the country.... So delicious with the hot naan bread!!!
We also tried a kind of chicken skewer (can't remember the name of it) which was delicious too.
Very nice place as well.
My wife so reticent about indian foods loved it!!!
we'll come back; again

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Delicious, very filling. Not for the light eater. You will go back again and again. I went by myself at first , then I brought friends.

data.title: solid representation of pan-indian dishes
data.text:
There's a reason why the lunch buffet is so popular here.
They put on a really good spread, with more vegetarian options than any other Indian buffet I have encountered.   It's usually got a nice mix of traditional dishes such as aloo gobi, tandoori, channa masala, saag, etc.   They consistently offer at least 3-4 fresh veggie selections in rotation.  If you get a chance to try any of the dishes with roasted peppers or the bhindi masala, don't miss them.
You'll also see a selection of traditional south indian chaat items such as idli, upma, etc, on the buffet which is ambitious.

The waitstaff can be a little bit goofy, so if you're not up for banter, just don't engage....my teenage niece was very embarrassed by our regular waiter.

Top notch value on the buffet.   The evening is off the menu only, but they do a very servicable dosa and south indian thali.

Not the fanciest or most regional Indian food you're going to have, but pretty danged good for Hayward, and a great value!
